com.solacesystems.jms

Interface SolConnectionFactory

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ConnectionFactory, QueueConnectionFactory, Referenceable, TopicConnectionFactory
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    SolXAConnectionFactory
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SolConnectionFactoryImpl, SolXAConnectionFactoryImpl

    @ProviderType
public interface SolConnectionFactory
extends ConnectionFactory, QueueConnectionFactory, TopicConnectionFactory, Referenceable
    This is an interface to our proprietary implementation of a ConnectionFactory.

    • Method Detail

      • getAuthenticationScheme

        String getAuthenticationScheme()
        This property specifies the authentication scheme.

        Values are one of

        • SupportedProperty.AUTHENTICATION_SCHEME_BASIC (username/password based authentication)
        • SupportedProperty.AUTHENTICATION_SCHEME_CLIENT_CERTIFICATE (Client Certificate based authentication)
        • SupportedProperty.AUTHENTICATION_SCHEME_GSS_KRB (Kerberos based authentication)

        Default: SupportedProperty.AUTHENTICATION_SCHEME_BASIC

        Returns:
        The authentication scheme

      • setAuthenticationScheme

        void setAuthenticationScheme(String scheme)
        This property specifies the authentication scheme.

        Values are one of

        • SupportedProperty.AUTHENTICATION_SCHEME_BASIC (username/password authentication)
        • SupportedProperty.AUTHENTICATION_SCHEME_CLIENT_CERTIFICATE (Client Certificate based authentication)
        • SupportedProperty.AUTHENTICATION_SCHEME_GSS_KRB (Kerberos based authentication)

        Default: SupportedProperty.AUTHENTICATION_SCHEME_BASIC

        Parameters:
        scheme - The authentication scheme

      • getBrowserTimeoutInMS

        Integer getBrowserTimeoutInMS()
        This property specifies the maximum time in milliseconds for a QueueBrowser Enumeration.hasMoreElements() to wait for a message to arrive in the browser's local message buffer before returning. If there is already a message waiting Enumeration.hasMoreElements() returns immediately. A value of 0 means wait forever ( Enumeration.hasMoreElements() will return false only on closing the browser). A value < 0 will return immediately.

        Default: -1 (return immediately)

        Returns:
        the BrowserTimeoutInMS property value, null if not set.

      • setBrowserTimeoutInMS

        void setBrowserTimeoutInMS(Integer timeout)
        This property specifies the maximum time in milliseconds for a QueueBrowser Enumeration.hasMoreElements() to wait for a message to arrive in the browser's local message buffer before returning. If there is already a message waiting Enumeration.hasMoreElements() returns immediately. A value of 0 means wait forever ( Enumeration.hasMoreElements() will return false only on closing the browser). A value < 0 will return immediately.

        Default: -1 (return immediately)

        Parameters:
        timeout - the BrowserTimeoutInMS property value, null to unset.

      • getCallbackOnIOThread

        Boolean getCallbackOnIOThread()
        This property specifies whether to call MessageListeners directly from the IO thread. If false, MessageListeners are called from a consumer notification thread.

        Default: false

        Returns:
        the CallbackOnIOThread property value, null if not set.

      • setCallbackOnIOThread

        void setCallbackOnIOThread(Boolean callbackOnIOThread)
        This property specifies whether to call MessageListeners directly from the IO thread. If false, MessageListeners are called from a consumer notification thread.

        Default: false

        Parameters:
        callbackOnIOThread - the CallbackOnIOThread property value, null to unset.

      • getClientDescription

        String getClientDescription()
        This property is used to specify the application description on the appliance for the data connection.

        Format: Must be a maximum of 254 ASCII characters.

        Default: “”

        Returns:
        the ClientDescription property value, null if not set.

      • setClientDescription

        void setClientDescription(String clientDescription)

        Format: Must be a maximum of 254 ASCII characters.

        Default: “”

        Parameters:
        clientDescription - the ClientDescription property value, null to unset.

      • getClientID

        String getClientID()
        This property is used to specify the client name on the appliance for the data connection. The default client ID used is generated by the API.

        Format: Must be a valid topic name and a maximum of 160 bytes when encoded in UTF-8.

        Default: a generated client ID

        Returns:
        the ClientID property value, null if not set.

      • setClientID

        void setClientID(String clientID)
        This property is used to specify the client name on the appliance for the data connection. The default client ID used is generated by the API.

        Format: Must be a valid topic name and a maximum of 160 bytes when encoded in UTF-8.

        Default: a generated client ID

        Parameters:
        clientID - the ClientID property value, null to unset.

      • getCompressionLevel

        Integer getCompressionLevel()
        This property is used to enable and specify the ZLIB compression level.

        Format: Must be a value [-1..9]. -1 means use the JNDI connection’s compression level. O disables compression. 1-9 sets the ZLIB compression level.

        Default: -1 (use JNDI connection’s compression level, 0 if no JNDI connection)

        Returns:
        the CompressionLevel property value, null if not set.

      • setCompressionLevel

        void setCompressionLevel(Integer compressionLevel)
        This property is used to enable and specify the ZLIB compression level.

        Format: Must be a value [-1..9]. -1 means use the JNDI connection’s compression level. O disables compression. 1-9 sets the ZLIB compression level.

        Default: -1 (use JNDI connection’s compression level, 0 if no JNDI connection)

        Parameters:
        compressionLevel - the CompressionLevel property value, null to unset.

      • getConnectRetries

        Integer getConnectRetries()
        This property is used to specify the total number of times to attempt and retry a connection when establishing an initial connection for a Session to a host router.

        Format: Valid values are [-1.. 2147483647]. -1 means retry forever.

        Default: 0 (don’t retry)

        Returns:
        the ConnectRetries property value, null if not set.

      • setConnectRetries

        void setConnectRetries(Integer connectRetries)
        This property is used to specify the total number of times to attempt and retry a connection when establishing an initial connection for a Session to a host router.

        Format: Valid values are [-1.. 2147483647]. -1 means retry forever.

        Default: 0 (don’t retry)

        Parameters:
        connectRetries - the ConnectRetries property value, null to unset.

      • getConnectRetriesPerHost

        Integer getConnectRetriesPerHost()
        This property is used to specify the number of times to retry data connection attempts to a single host before moving on to the next host in the list. Valid for host lists only.

        Format: Valid values are [-1.. 2147483647]. -1 means retry forever.

        Default: 0 (don’t retry)

        Returns:
        the ConnectRetriesPerHost property value, null if not set.

      • setConnectRetriesPerHost

        void setConnectRetriesPerHost(Integer connectRetriesPerHost)
        This property is used to specify the number of times to retry data connection attempts to a single host before moving on to the next host in the list. Valid for host lists only.

        Format: Valid values are [-1.. 2147483647]. -1 means retry forever.

        Default: 0 (don’t retry)

        Parameters:
        connectRetriesPerHost - the ConnectRetriesPerHost property value, null to unset.

      • getConnectTimeoutInMillis

        Integer getConnectTimeoutInMillis()
        This property is used to specify the timeout in milliseconds on a data connection attempt.

        Format: In milliseconds. Valid values are [0..2147483647]. 0 means wait forever.

        Default: The default value is 30000 (30 seconds)

        Returns:
        the ConnectTimeoutInMillis property value, null if not set.

      • setConnectTimeoutInMillis

        void setConnectTimeoutInMillis(Integer connectTimeoutInMillis)
        This property is used to specify the timeout in milliseconds on a data connection attempt.

        Format: In milliseconds. Valid values are [0..2147483647]. 0 means wait forever.

        Default: The default value is 30000 (30 seconds)

        Parameters:
        connectTimeoutInMillis - the ConnectTimeoutInMillis property value, null to unset.

      • getDeliverToOneOverride

        Boolean getDeliverToOneOverride()
        This property specifies whether to override deliver to one settings. Used only with direct messaging. When enabled, the API will be allowed to receive all deliver to one tagged messages.

        Default: true.

        Returns:
        the DeliverToOneOverride property value, null if not set.

      • setDeliverToOneOverride

        void setDeliverToOneOverride(Boolean deliverToOneOverride)
        This property specifies whether to override deliver to one settings. Used only with direct messaging. When enabled, the API will be allowed to receive all deliver to one tagged messages.

        Default: true.

        Parameters:
        deliverToOneOverride - the DeliverToOneOverride property value, null to unset.

      • getDirectOptimized

        Boolean getDirectOptimized()
        This property specifies whether to optimize the API for direct transport. When optimization is enabled, the application is restricted to creating at most one consumer or producer per connection.

        Default: false.

        Returns:
        DirectOptimized property value, null if not set.

      • setDirectOptimized

        void setDirectOptimized(Boolean directOptimized)
        This property specifies whether to optimize the API for direct transport. When optimization is enabled, the application is restricted to creating at most one consumer or producer per connection.

        Default: false.

        Parameters:
        directOptimized - the DirectOptimized property value, null to unset.

      • getDirectTransport

        Boolean getDirectTransport()
        This property specifies whether to use direct transport for non-persistent messages.

        Default: true.

      • getHost

        String getHost()
        This property is the hostname / IP address of the appliance. This property can be set through a passed in environment with the property: @link Context#. The API extracts the host from the URL.
        Returns:
        Host property value, null if not set.

      • setHost

        void setHost(String host)
        This property is the hostname / IP address of the appliance. This property can be set through a passed in environment with the property: InitialContext.PROVIDER_URL. The API extracts the host from the URL.

        Usage A host entry has the following form:

        [Protocol:]Host[:Port]

        Protocol is the protocol used for the transport channel. The valid values are:

        • smf or tcp - use a TCP channel for communications between the application and its peers. If no protocol is set, smf is used as a default.
        • smfs or tcps - use a SSL channel over TCP for communications between the application and its peers. The encryption with compression is not supported.

        Host is the IP address (or host name) to connect to for a connection. Port is the port to connect to for a connection. A value is only required when using a port other than the automatically assigned default port number. The default port for smf is 55555 when compression is not in use, or 55003 when compression is in use. The default port for SSL is 55443.

        Configuring Multiple Hosts for Redundancy and Failover

        Some applications might want to have a list of appliances available for connection. Use of a host list allows applications to connect to the alternate connections should the first appliance be unavailable. The host list is configured as a comma-separated list of hosts. Each host can optionally include a port number as well. For example, if there are two appliances at 192.168.160.128 and 192.168.160.129, but the second is using the non-default port 50005 for the message bus, the HOST property would be configured as:
        "192.168.160.128,192.168.160.129:50005"

        When a connection is attempted, the API first attempts to connect to 192.168.160.128. If that connection fails for any reason, it attempts to connect to 192.168.160.129:50005. This process is repeated until all other entries in the host list are attempted.

        After each entry has been attempted, and if all fail, the channel properties ConnectRetries, ReconnectRetries, and ReconnectRetryWaitInMillis determine the behavior of the API. If ConnectRetries is non-zero, the API waits for the amount of time set for ReconnectRetryWaitInMillis, then starts its connection attempts again from the beginning of the list. When traversing the list, each entry is attempted the number of times set for the ConnectRetriesPerHost property + 1.

        If an established session to any host in the list fails, when ReconnectRetries is non-zero, the API automatically attempts to reconnect, starting at the beginning of the list.

        Limitations

        It is possible to specify a list of hosts to connect to, if connecting to Solace appliances running SolOS-TR. When using this feature, Guaranteed Messaging state can be reset when switching between hosts. If a client application publishes Guaranteed messages in a Session, and then a disconnect occurs, the API will not automatically reconnect to other listed hosts because another host will not know the state of the publisher flow to the original host. Without knowledge of the publisher flow’s state, it cannot be guaranteed that any unacknowledged published messages will be properly handled when another publisher flow is created to a new host. Therefore, when publishing Guaranteed messages and using a host list, the client application is responsible for recreating its Session to another listed host and keeping track of any published messages that have not been acknowledged by the host appliance when the disconnect occurs.

        For typical Guaranteed Messaging scenarios, redundancy is achieved by using an active/standby pair of appliances sharing the same IP address, so only one host entry is required in the session HOST property. In this situation, once-and-only-once delivery is guaranteed.

        Parameters:
        host - the Host property value, null to unset.

        void setReceiveAdAckThreshold(Integer receiveAdAckThreshold)
        This property specifies the threshold for sending an acknowledgement to the appliance. The threshold for sending an acknowledgement, configured as a percentage. The API sends a transport acknowledgment every N messages where N is calculated as this percentage of the flow window size if the endpoint's max-delivered-unacked-msgs-per-flow setting at bind time is greater than or equal to the transport window size. Otherwise, N is calculated as this percentage of the endpoint's max-delivered-unacked-msgs-per-flow setting at bind time.

      • getSSLValidateCertificate

        Boolean getSSLValidateCertificate()
        This property is used to indicate that the API should validate server certificates with certificates in the trust store. If set to false, no validation of the certificate date or common name is performed.

        Format: Valid values are true, false.

        Default: true

        Returns:
        True if certificate validation is enabled.

      • setSSLValidateCertificate

        void setSSLValidateCertificate(Boolean validate)
        This property is used to indicate that the API should validate server certificates with certificates in the trust store. If set to false, no validation of the certificate date or common name is performed.
        SupportedProperty.SOLACE_JMS_SSL_VALIDATE_CERTIFICATE Boolean true This property is used to specify whether the API should validate server certificates with certificates in the truststore. If set to false, no validation of the certificate date or common name is performed.

        Note on certificate validation:
        When validating certificates, the messaging APIs for C and .NET use the following validation rules, after building the chain from the server certificate to a self-signed root certificate using certificates presented by the server and certificates in the trust store :
        • Verify the root certificate is trusted.
        • Verify depth of the chain is less than or equal to 3.


        Java and JMS messaging APIs use the same rules as C and .NET with the following exceptions:
        • Depth validation is not enforced in Java or JMS.
        • When the server presents an incomplete certificate chain, Java/JMS messaging APIs only require the signer of the incomplete certificate chain to be in the trust store, where this could be insufficient for C/.NET APIs.

        Therefore C and .NET messaging APIs certificate validation rules are more restrictive, hence if a certificate is accepted by C or .NET, it will definitely be accepted by Java and JMS.

        Format: Valid values are true, false.

        Default: true

        Parameters:
        validate - The SSL Validate Certificate property, null to unset.

      • getSSLValidateCertificateDate

      • getSSLCipherSuites

        String getSSLCipherSuites()
        This property specifies a comma separated list of the cipher suites to enable in order of preference. Cipher suites can be specified using their JSSE name or OpenSSL name. The following is the list of supported Cipher suites (showing the JSSE name with the OpenSSL name in brackets):
        • TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384 (ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384) * Supported starting with Java 8 and requires installation of the JCE Unlimited Strength Jurisdiction Policy Files
        • TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA384 (ECDHE-RSA-AES256-SHA384) * Supported starting with Java 7 and requires installation of the JCE Unlimited Strength Jurisdiction Policy Files
        • TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA (ECDHE-RSA-AES256-SHA) * Supported starting with Java 7 and requires installation of the JCE Unlimited Strength Jurisdiction Policy Files
        • TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384 (AES256-GCM-SHA384) * Supported starting with Java 8 and requires installation of the JCE Unlimited Strength Jurisdiction Policy Files
        • TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA256 (AES256-SHA256) * Supported starting with Java 7 and requires installation of the JCE Unlimited Strength Jurisdiction Policy Files
        • TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA (AES256-SHA) * Requires installation of the JCE Unlimited Strength Jurisdiction Policy Files
        • TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA (ECDHE-RSA-DES-CBC3-SHA) * Supported starting with Java 7
        • SSL_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA (DES-CBC3-SHA)
        • TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256 (ECDHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256) * Supported starting with Java 8
        • TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256 (ECDHE-RSA-AES128-SHA256) * Supported starting with Java 7
        • TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA (ECDHE-RSA-AES128-SHA) * Supported starting with Java 7
        • TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256 (AES128-GCM-SHA256) * Supported starting with Java 8
        • TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256 (AES128-SHA256) * Supported starting with Java 7
        • TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA (AES128-SHA)
        • SSL_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA (RC4-SHA)
        • SSL_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_MD5 (RC4-MD5)

        Format: Comma separated list of cipher names.

        Default: All supported ciphers.

        Returns:
        The list of ciphers.

      • setSSLCipherSuites

        void setSSLCipherSuites(String cipherSuites)
        This property specifies a comma separated list of the cipher suites to enable in order of preference. Cipher suites can be specified using their JSSE name or OpenSSL name. The following is the list of supported Cipher suites (showing the JSSE name with the OpenSSL name in brackets):
        • TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384 (ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384) * Supported starting with Java 8 and requires installation of the JCE Unlimited Strength Jurisdiction Policy Files
        • TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA384 (ECDHE-RSA-AES256-SHA384) * Supported starting with Java 7 and requires installation of the JCE Unlimited Strength Jurisdiction Policy Files
        • TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA (ECDHE-RSA-AES256-SHA) * Supported starting with Java 7 and requires installation of the JCE Unlimited Strength Jurisdiction Policy Files
        • TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384 (AES256-GCM-SHA384) * Supported starting with Java 8 and requires installation of the JCE Unlimited Strength Jurisdiction Policy Files
        • TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA256 (AES256-SHA256) * Supported starting with Java 7 and requires installation of the JCE Unlimited Strength Jurisdiction Policy Files
        • TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA (AES256-SHA) * Requires installation of the JCE Unlimited Strength Jurisdiction Policy Files
        • TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA (ECDHE-RSA-DES-CBC3-SHA) * Supported starting with Java 7
        • SSL_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA (DES-CBC3-SHA)
        • TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256 (ECDHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256) * Supported starting with Java 8
        • TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256 (ECDHE-RSA-AES128-SHA256) * Supported starting with Java 7
        • TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA (ECDHE-RSA-AES128-SHA) * Supported starting with Java 7
        • TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256 (AES128-GCM-SHA256) * Supported starting with Java 8
        • TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256 (AES128-SHA256) * Supported starting with Java 7
        • TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA (AES128-SHA)
        • SSL_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA (RC4-SHA)
        • SSL_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_MD5 (RC4-MD5)

        Format: Comma separated list of cipher names.

        Default: All supported ciphers.

        Parameters:
        cipherSuites - The list of ciphers to enable, null to unset.

      • getSSLTrustedCommonNameList

        String getSSLTrustedCommonNameList()
        This property specifies the list of acceptable common names for matching in server certificates. The API performs a case insensitive comparison of the common names provided in this property with the common name in the server certificate. No common names provided means that all common names are acceptable. No common name validation will be performed (overriding this property) if certificate validation is set to false.

        Format: A comma separated list of common names.

        Default: No common names provided means that all common names are acceptable.

        Returns:
        The list of acceptable common names for matching in server certificates.

      • setSSLTrustedCommonNameList

        void setSSLTrustedCommonNameList(String commonNames)
        This property specifies the list of acceptable common names for matching in server certificates. The API performs a case insensitive comparison of the common names provided in this property with the common name in the server certificate. No common names provided means that all common names are acceptable. No common name validation will be performed (overriding this property) if certificate validation is set to false.

        Format: A comma separated list of common names.

        Default: No common names provided means that all common names are acceptable.

        Parameters:
        commonNames - The list of acceptable common names for matching in server certificates, null to unset.

      • getSubscriberLocalPriority

        Integer getSubscriberLocalPriority()

      • getTcpNoDelay

        Boolean getTcpNoDelay()

        Default: true

      • getUseDefaultContext

        Default: false (creates a new context for every connection)

      • getUsername

        String getUsername()
        This property is used to specify the username to connect to the appliance with. This property can be set through a passed in environment with the property: InitialContext.PROVIDER_URL. The API extracts the username from the URL.

        Format: The maximum length is 189 bytes when encoded in UTF-8 (with SolOS-TR 6.1 and above)

        Returns:
        Username property value, null if not set.

      • setUsername

        void setUsername(String username)
        This property is used to specify the username to connect to the appliance with. This property can be set through a passed in environment with the property: InitialContext.PROVIDER_URL. The API extracts the username from the URL.
        Username is optional when using SupportedProperty.AUTHENTICATION_SCHEME_CLIENT_CERTIFICATE (Client Certificate based authentication) with setAuthenticationScheme(String)

        Format: The maximum length is 189 bytes when encoded in UTF-8 (with SolOS-TR 6.1 and above).

        Parameters:
        username - the Username property value, null to unset.

      • getVPN

        String getVPN()
        This property is used to specify the VPN to use when connecting to the appliance. The default value is “” which means connect to the default VPN.

        Format: The maximum length is 32 bytes when encoded in UTF-8

        Default: “”

        Returns:
        VPN property value, null if not set.

      • setVPN

        void setVPN(String vpn)
        This property is used to specify the VPN to use when connecting to the appliance. The default value is “” which means connect to the default VPN.

        Format: The maximum length is 32 bytes when encoded in UTF-8

        Default: “”

        Parameters:
        vpn - the VPN property value, null to unset.

      • getPropertyNames

      • getProperty

        Object getProperty(String name)
        Gets the property value given its name. The name must be one of the values in the set from getPropertyNames()
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the property to return
        Returns:
        The named property's value

      • setProperty

        void setProperty(String name,
               Object value)
        Sets a property's value given its name. The name must be one of the values in the set from getPropertyNames()
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the property to set
        value - The value to set the property t
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - on error

      • getEffectiveProperty

        Object getEffectiveProperty(String name)
        Gets a property's value given its name. The name must be one of the values in the set from getPropertyNames() This method differs from getProperty(String) in that it returns the value that will be used in connection creation. If a property has not been set through the api (or even if it has), this method may return the default value or another value that overrides the connection factory's value.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the property to return.
        Returns:
        The named property's effective value for connection creation.

      • toEffectiveString

        String toEffectiveString()
        Returns a string representation of all the property values as if the method getEffectiveProperty(String) was used to retrieve them.
        Returns:
        A string representation of the effective property values.
